Name: Statue of Thoth in The Human Form
Description: The statue represents the god Thoth as a human with the head of an ibis. The god is standing on a base, with his left leg forward. His arms are raised and he is holding a jar in both hands, giving the impression that he would drink from it. He is wearing a long wig and the pleated kilt, called the shendyt.The god Thoth was most frequently portrayed as an ibis-headed man from the end of the Old Kingdom onwards. In the Pyramid Texts, the inscriptions attest that the gods gained access to the netherworld by traveling "on the wing of Thoth."
